title: Joseph in Potiphar’s House
summary: Genesis 39 describes Joseph’s time in Egypt serving Potiphar. God blesses his work, but Potiphar’s wife falsely accuses him of assault after he refuses her advances. Joseph is thrown into prison, yet God remains with him.

faq.question: Why was Joseph successful in Potiphar’s house?
faq.answer: Because God was with him, blessing all he did.

faq.question: Why was Joseph imprisoned?
faq.answer: Potiphar’s wife falsely accused him of trying to assault her after he rejected her repeatedly.

faq.question: What does it mean that Joseph left his clothes in her hand?
faq.answer: It means Potiphar’s wife grabbed Joseph by his clothes to make him stay, but Joseph pulled away so quickly that his robe came off and he ran out. It shows how badly he wanted to avoid sin—he’d rather lose his clothes than do something wrong.

faq.question: What does it mean that Joseph ran Potiphar’s house and later the prison?
faq.answer: Joseph was like a manager or overseer. Even though he was a servant or a prisoner, people trusted him because he was responsible and wise. He organized everything and made sure things ran smoothly, kind of like a head worker or assistant leader.
